TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi HttpEncoder extends System.Object

span.span: Provides encoding and decoding logic.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类包含类中的方法使用的编码和解码逻辑，如、 和。The class contains encoding and decoding logic that is used by methods in classes such as , , and . 可以从类继承并重写其行为，以自定义 ASP.NET 的默认编码和解码行为。You can inherit from the class and override its behavior to customize the default encoding and decoding behavior of ASP.NET. 然后，设置 类的属性以配置自定义类。You then set the property of the class to configure your custom class. 派生自的编码和解码的自定义类可以覆盖内置的 ASP.NET 编码和解码行为，或仅更改其所选的方面。A custom class for encoding and decoding that derives from can override the built-in ASP.NET encoding and decoding behavior or change only selected aspects of it. 可以在 ASP.NET 中配置自定义编码类型，以替换或补充以下编码行为：You can configure the custom encoding type for in ASP.NET to replace or supplement the following encoding behavior: - HTML 编码HTML encoding - HTML 特性编码HTML attribute encoding - URL 编码URL encoding - URL 路径编码URL path encoding - HTTP 标头名称和标头值编码HTTP header name and header value encoding 默认情况下，ASP.NET 应用程序配置为使用所有输出编码的类型。By default, ASP.NET applications are configured to use the type for all output encoding. 应用程序级 web.config 文件中的以下示例显示了如何为 ASP.NET 应用程序设置类型：The following example from an application-level Web.config file shows how the type is set for an ASP.NET application: `` 该示例中的配置设置将类设置为在应用程序中执行所有输出编码。The configuration setting in the example sets the class to perform all output encoding in the application. 有关详细信息，请参阅类概述。For more information, see the class overview.

para.span: 当创建自定义编码器类并重写基类的基方法时，派生的编码器可能会从任何重写的方法中引发异常。

span.span: When you create a custom encoder class and override the base methods of the base class, the derived encoder might throw an exception from any of the overridden methods.

para.span: 但是，在以下情况下，引发此类异常可能会导致 ASP.NET 中出现意外行为：

span.span: However, in the following cases throwing such an exception could lead to unexpected behavior in ASP.NET:

para.span: -如果 ASP.NET 呈现由自定义编码器引发的未经处理的异常导致的错误页，则 ASP.NET 不会尝试通过调用自定义编码器来编码其错误输出。

span.span: - If ASP.NET is rendering an error page that is caused by an unhandled exception that was thrown from a custom encoder, ASP.NET does not attempt to encode its error output by calling into the custom encoder.

para.span: 这样可以避免递归错误情况。

span.span: This avoids recursive error conditions.

para.span: -当 ASP.NET 向 IIS 发送 HTTP 标头时，ASP.NET 不会预配未经处理的异常。

span.span: - When ASP.NET is sending HTTP headers to IIS, ASP.NET has no provision for unhandled exceptions.

para.span: 因此，将呈现标准的 ASP.NET 错误页（如果配置设置允许显示此页）。

span.span: Therefore, the standard ASP.NET error page will be rendered (if configuration settings allows this page to be displayed).

summary.span: 获取或设置将在应用程序中使用的 类型。

span.span: Gets or set the type that will be used in an application.

value.span: 对将要使用的编码器/解码器类型的引用。

span.span: A reference to the encoder/decoder type that will be used.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果在配置文件中指定派生类型，则属性将返回对自定义类型的引用。If a derived type is specified in the configuration file, the property returns a reference to the custom type. 但是，如果未使用自定义编码器，则属性将返回对默认 ASP.NET 实例的引用。However, if no custom encoder is used, the property returns a reference to the default ASP.NET instance. 此属性不是线程安全的。The property is not thread-safe. 仅在应用程序的`Application_Start`方法中设置此属性，因为`Application_Start`在单个线程上运行。Set this property only in the application's `Application_Start` method, because `Application_Start` runs on a single thread.

exception.span: 分配给此属性的编码器实例是 。

span.span: The encoder instance that is being assigned to this property is .

summary.span: 获取对 ASP.NET 的默认编码器的引用。

span.span: Gets a reference to the default encoder for ASP.NET.
A reference to the default encoder.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 常见的编码问题在于，默认 ASP.NET 行为会将空格转换为 "+" 字符。A common encoding issue is that the default ASP.NET behavior converts spaces into the "+" character. 从历史角度来看，"+" 字符是将 URL 中的空格字符编码为更易于阅读的方式的 Internet 约定。Historically, the "+" character has been an Internet convention for encoding space characters in a URL into a more human-readable manner. 但是，根据标准，空格字符应编码为 "% 20"，而不是 "+" 字符。However, according to standards, the space character is supposed to be encoded as "%20" and instead of as the "+" character. ASP.NET 允许你实现更符合标准的编码算法。ASP.NET lets you implement a more standards compliant encoding algorithm.

param.span: 要编码的 HTTP 标头名称。

param.span: 要编码的 HTTP 标头值。

span.span: The HTTP header value to encode.

param.span: 当此方法返回时，返回值包含要用于 HTTP 标头的已编码名称。

param.name: encodedHeaderValue
param.span: 当此方法返回时，返回值包含要用于 HTTP 标头的已编码值。

param.span: 此参数未经初始化即被传递。

span.span: This parameter is passed uninitialized.

summary.span: 将标头名称和值编码为可用作 HTTP 标头的字符串。

span.span: Encodes a header name and value into a string that can be used as an HTTP header.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法从`headerName` 和`headerValue`参数获取输入字符串并对它们进行编码。 The method takes input strings from the `headerName` and `headerValue` parameters and encodes them. 编码值作为输出参数返回。The encoded values are returned as out parameters. 方法使用以下逻辑对标头名称和值进行编码：The method uses the following logic to encode header names and values: - Unicode 值小于 ascii 字符32的所有字符（ascii 字符9除外）都将 URL 编码为`%NN` `N`字符表示十六进制值的格式。All characters whose Unicode value is less than ASCII character 32, except ASCII character 9, are URL-encoded into a format of `%NN` where the `N` characters represent hexadecimal values. - ASCII 字符9（水平制表符）未进行 URL 编码。ASCII character 9 (the horizontal tab character) is not URL-encoded. - ASCII 字符127编码为`%7F`。ASCII character 127 is encoded as `%7F`. - 所有其他字符不进行编码。All other characters are not encoded. > [!NOTE] > 尽管此方法可用于 Unicode 值，但它通常用于 ASCII 范围内的值。Although this method can be used for Unicode values, it is typically used for values in the ASCII range. 如果 `headerValue` `encodedHeaderValue`为或为空字符串，则方法的默认实现将返回中的值。`null` `headerValue`The default implementation of the method returns the value of `headerValue` in `encodedHeaderValue` if `headerValue` is `null` or is an empty string. 同样`headerName` ，如果`encodedHeaderName` `headerName`为或为空字符串，则默认实现将返回中的值。`null`Similarly, the default implementation returns the value of `headerName` in `encodedHeaderName` if `headerName` is `null` or is an empty string.

span.span: The string to encode.

param.name: output
param.span: 要将已编码值写入到的文本编写器。

span.span: The text writer to write the encoded value to.

summary.span: 将传入值编码为可插入 HTML 特性（由单引号或双引号分隔）的字符串。

span.span: Encodes an incoming value into a string that can be inserted into an HTML attribute that is delimited by using single or double quotation marks.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使用标准 HTML 实体对字符进行编码。The method encodes characters by using the standard HTML entities. 例如， `<` （左尖括号）编码为`<` ， `\` （反斜杠）被编码为`\`。For example, the `<` (left angle bracket) is encoded as `<` and the `\` (backslash) is encoded as `\`. 可以安全地在带单引号和双引号的属性中使用。It is safe to use within single-quoted and double-quoted attributes. 值必须用引号引起来。The values must be quoted.

span.span: is .

span.span: The string to decode.

param.name: output
param.span: 要将已解码值写入到的文本编写器。

span.span: The text writer to write the decoded value to.

summary.span: 解码 HTML 编码的字符串中的值。

span.span: Decodes a value from an HTML-encoded string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 下表列出了 ASP.NET 解码逻辑可以解码的字符序列。The following table lists the character sequences that the ASP.NET decoding logic can decode. |字符序列Character sequence|规则Rule| |------------------------|----------| |`&#NNN;`（ASCII 字符的十进制代码）。`&#NNN;` (decimal codes for ASCII characters).|解码为指定的 ASCII 字符。Decoded as the specified ASCII character. 字符序列以 # 字符后的第一个数字开头，并以分号结束。The character sequence starts at the first digit after the # character and finishes at the semicolon.| |`&#xZZ;`（ASCII 字符的十六进制代码）。`&#xZZ;` (hexadecimal codes for ASCII characters).|解码为指定的 ASCII 字符。Decoded as the specified ASCII character. 编码的窗体通过使用十六进制字符而不是十进制值来指定字符。The encoded form specifies the character by using hexadecimal characters instead of a decimal value. 字符序列以 # 字符后的第一个数字开头，并以分号结束。The character sequence starts at the first digit after the # character and finishes at the semicolon.| |命名的 HTML 实体。Named HTML entities.|解码为等效的 ASCII 字符。Decoded as the equivalent ASCII character.|

span.span: is .

summary.span: 将字符串编码为 HTML 编码的字符串。

span.span: Encodes a string into an HTML-encoded string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 下表列出了 ASP.NET 编码逻辑可以解码的字符序列。The following table lists the character sequences that the ASP.NET encoding logic can decode. |字符Character|编码为Encoded as| |---------------|----------------| |`<`（左尖括号）`<` (left angle bracket)|`<`| |`>`（右尖括号）`>` (right angle bracket)|`>`| |`"`（双引号）`"` (double quotation marks)|`"`| |`&`前面`&` (ampersand)|`&`| |`\`（反斜杠） |`\``\` (backslash)|`\`| |从160到255的 ASCII 字符ASCII characters from 160 to 255|`&#NNN;`，其中`NNN`是三位十进制字符代码`&#NNN;`, where `NNN` is the three-digit decimal character code| 如果重写方法，则必须生成在带引号或单引号的 HTML 特性内也安全的输出。If you override the method, you must produce output that is also safe within double-quoted or single-quoted HTML attributes. 这适用于 Razor 引擎的分析，其中标记和代码可以组合在一起，如\。This accommodates parsing by the Razor engine, where markup and code can be combined, such as \. 此外，当 Razor 引擎处理时，@ 运算符不能识别上下文，因此它调用 而不是。In addition, the @ operator is not context-aware when processed by the Razor engine, therefore it calls rather than .

span.span: is .

span.span: The string to encode.
Encodes a string.
An encoded string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks URL 编码可确保所有浏览器都正确传输 URL 字符串中的文本。URL encoding makes sure that all browsers correctly transmit text in URL strings. 某些浏览器可能会截断或损坏诸如问号（？）、与号（&）、斜杠（/）和空格等字符。Characters such as a question mark (?), ampersand (&), slash (/), and spaces might be truncated or corrupted by some browsers. 因此，必须对这些字符进行编码。Therefore, these characters must be encoded.

span.span: An array of bytes to encode.

param.name: offset
param.span: 数组中作为编码起始点的位置。

The number of items in the array to encode.

summary.span: 将 URL 中不允许使用的字符数组编码为等效十六进制字符实体。

span.span: Encodes an array of characters that are not allowed in a URL into a hexadecimal character-entity equivalent.
An array of encoded characters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法由类中的多个 URL 编码方法调用。 The method is called by several URL encoding methods in the class. 方法对不在被视为 URL 安全的 ASCII 字符集中的任何字符进行 url 编码。The method URL-encodes any character that is not in the set of ASCII characters that is considered to be URL-safe. 空格编码为 ASCII "`+"`字符。Spaces are encoded as the ASCII "`+"` character. URL 安全的 ASCII 字符包括 ASCII 字符（A 到 Z 和 a 到 z）、数字（0到9）和某些标点符号。URL-safe ASCII characters include the ASCII characters (A to Z and a to z), numerals (0 to 9), and some punctuation marks. 下表列出了被视为 URL 安全 ASCII 字符的标点符号。The following table lists the punctuation marks that are considered URL-safe ASCII characters. |字符Character|说明Description| |---------------|-----------------| |-|连字符Hyphen| |__|强调Underscore| |。.|句点（点）Period (dot)| |!!|感叹号Exclamation mark| |*|星号（星号）Asterisk (star)| |((|左括号Opening parenthesis| |))|右括号Closing parenthesis|

exception.span: 小于零或大于 数组的长度。

span.span: is less than zero or greater than the length of the array.
-or-

exception.span: 小于零或 加上 大于 数组的长度。

span.span: is less than zero or plus is greater than the length of the array.
is .

span.span: The string to encode.

summary.span: 对 URL 的子节进行编码。

span.span: Encodes a subsection of a URL.
A URL-encoded string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法由 方法调用。The method is called by the method. 方法执行以下步骤：The method performs the following steps: - 将方法的编码逻辑仅应用到 URL 的路径部分（不包括查询字符串）。Applies the encoding logic of the method to only the path part of the URL (which excludes the query string). 方法假定 URL 编码为 UTF-8 字符串。The method assumes that the URL is encoded as a UTF-8 string. - 对非空格编码，以便在生成的编码字符串中仅使用前128个 ASCII 字符的子集。Encodes non-spaces so that only a subset of the first 128 ASCII characters is used in the resulting encoded string. Unicode 值为128、更高、32和更小的任何字符都是 URL 编码的。Any characters at Unicode value 128 and greater, or 32 and less, are URL-encoded. - 将空格编码为% 20。Encodes spaces as %20.
